data.title: David Alexander Buckner (1837-1913)
data.meta_description: Is this your ancestor? Compare DNA and explore genealogy for David Buckner born 1837 Rural Dry Valley, White County, Tennessee, U S A died 1913 Monterey, Putnam County, Tennessee, U S A including ancestors + descendants + Y-chromosome DNA + more in the free family tree community.
data.text:
Ancestors Descendants

Profile last modified 1 Dec 2022 | Created 27 Dec 2015

This page has been accessed 628 times.

Contents

1 Biography

2 Research Notes

2.1 Facts with no date

2.2 Sources with no fact or date

2.3 Issues to be checked

3 Sources

Biography

David Alexander "Alex" Buckner was born in 1837. He passed away in 1913. He married Margaret Whittaker and lived most of his life in Putnam County, Tennessee. His family were involved with Polly Brewington, the legendary "Buckner Witch" of Putnam County.[1]

David was born on 31 July 1837 in Tennessee, USA. He was the son of George William Buckner and Catherine (Verble) Buckner.[2]

In the 1860 census David (age 22) was living in District 3, Putnam, Tennessee, USA.[2]

When David was about 30 he married in 1868.[3]

In the 1900 census David (age 62) was living in Civil District 14, Putnam, Tennessee, USA.[4]

In the 1910 census David (age 72) was living in Monterey, Putnam, Tennessee, USA.[5]

David died at the age of 75 on 4 May 1913 and was buried in Monterey, Putnam, Tennessee, USA.[6]

Research Notes

Facts with no date

Photo: in (M815).

Sources with no fact or date

There are additional sources with no facts or date. Often these are sources for the baptism or marriage of children that mention the parents or father. This section can just be removed if you will be adding those children and using these sources there.[7]

Issues to be checked

Generated by WikiTree AGC. This section should be removed when all issues have been looked at.

A burial fact had no date. Changed its date to be after the death date.
